HeadingParagraphs: Hello! My name is Reed Spratt, and I am a working professional in the computer games industry.
I am a MSc graduate in computer science and a passionate games researcher, designer, programmer, and tester, always striving to learn new skills and technologies.
FooterParagraphs: A selection of my recent work can be found on the other pages linked above, or on my Github linked to the right.

HeadingParagraphs: In recent years, I have migrated to spending more time creating and researching games over playing them. However, I draw a lot of inspiration from the games I have played, so I would like to outline a few here.

Items: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

HeadingParagraphs: I attended the University of Guelph majoring in Software Engineering, and minoring in Music.
I attended Western University from 2021-2023, majoring in Computer Science.
I specialized in researching recommender systems, character AI for games, and relational database theory.

Since 2019, I have been offering programming services as a freelancer while working on my own independent projects. My work for the Unity and Roblox engine can be found on their respective pages linked in the top bar. My areas of specialization for work are listed below.

Items: Creation of Editor Tools for Unity
Creation of Plugins for Roblox Studio
Implementation of Dynamic Music in Games

HeadingParagraphs: I am currently employed at the Roblox experience development company SuperSocial as a QA Tester.
I have contributed to thirteen games with brand collaborations including: Fairview Portals, Gucci, NARS Cosmetics, Tokido and Walmart.

Items: Devising and executing test strategies for new brand experiences.
Conducting performance testing in development and live testing.
Communicating issues to other development teams after reporting.
Participating in and helping to lead coordinated team-wide test sessions.
Assisting the QA lead in configuring QA workflows and tools for use.

HeadingParagraphs: Worked as a QA tester in a volunteer capacity for the company MELON.
During my time here, I contributed to branded experiences including

Items: Performed exploratory and guided testing for upcoming games.
Provided feedback regarding UX and overall game design and feel.
Assisted engineering in debugging performance issues.
